Hi,

I'm developing an application to manage users stored in an LDAP repository. 
I'm doing unit tests for all the classes, but for the ones that access the 
LDAP repository the test depend on the existance of the stored data and it is 
not possible to automate the testing of error conditions. 

To solve this shortcomings I'm trying to find a way to really test the class 
functionality throughtly by being able to control the environment. I've found 
that Mockobjects have an implementation of the classes in javax.naming and 
javax.naming.directory. Is there anybody in the list with experiece using 
them? Is it a good way to test a class that access an LDAP?

Besides mockobjects, is there any solution similar to dbUnit but for LDAP?

I would appreciate any advice.

Thanks,
	Jorge
subject: Unit testing a class which accesses an LDAP repository
